duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide direct management of field construction activities in Hydrogen, Ammonia, Air Separation, or other process gas technologies for facilities that AP will own and operate.
Manage the execution of construction contracts at a project site with primary responsibility for meeting safety performance, quality, schedule, and cost objectives.
Plan and coordinate the activities of multiple subcontractors and manage construction contracts to ensure quality and that tasks are completed on time.
Analyze contractor progress and develop corrective action plans as the need arises.
Represent Air Products in a professional manner and work with other Superintendents as part of a site construction team.
Driving and enforcing a progressive safety program with the goal of zero incidents.
Clearing execution obstacles to provide opportunities for subcontractors to be successful.
Demonstrate passionate ownership of the scope of work and implement work practices to ensure safety, quality, and progress tracking.
Participate in efforts to improve group work processes and capabilities.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or related field (Master's preferred)
